message.content:
cs.HC, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM

The paper deals with developing a brain-computer interface to monitor users' states and reduce visual strain during stereoscopic vision. This involves using EEG technology to record brain activity and discriminate between comfortable and uncomfortable conditions. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Other likely sub-categories include cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as EEG is a technology that records brain activity, cs.CV (Computer Vision) as stereoscopic displays involve depth perception, cs.GR (Graphics) as the study involves visual comfort in displays, and cs.MM (Multimedia) as stereoscopic displays are a type of multimedia technology.
